title_short: (5300) Bragança - 9 Avenida Engenheiro Amaro da Costa

Probably unadvised to park when there's a service expected (i.e. Saturday night/Sunday morning and major feasts). A lovely over to the mountains and castle nearby. No facilities but great 5G.

 good for a hose in the parking lot next to it

title: (5300) Bragança - R. de São Francisco

The GNR has passed several times and has not stopped to ask us to clear the scene. Super quiet night! Anticipate lateral wedging! Parking breakdown when the municipal (nearby) is saturated.

If vehicles are parked there, they can be seen from the street. A few more parking spaces are behind it, just continue on the driveway. Beautiful view, tranquility, an old castell (or village) on the hill. There is a public toilet (round door) at the cemetery parking lot around the corner.

title: (5300) Bragança - Rua da Figueira

title: (5300-252) Bragança -

The absence of trees can be prohibitive in the summer season.

name: Cepo Verde
title: (5300-561) Cepo Verde
description: In the heart of Montesinho Natural Park, and 10 minutes away from the city of Bragança, the camping site is located in a mountain highland, filled with chestnut trees, oak trees and cherry trees and in a place recognised as an ancient Roman settlement. The campsite has individual spaces, with abundant shadows, and it provides a bar and restaurant open all year, with delicious traditional meals, homemade soup and pizzas done every day. In permanent exhibition at the bar/restaurant the world´s largest pocketknife with more than 2 meters high, registered int the Guiness World Records Book (original certificate exposed). The campers have full access to barbecue facilities outside. The park also has a traditional wood-fired oven in which bread is baked once a week. It is possible to pick cherries in June and July, and mushrooms in May and June, inside and outside the park. Offering a fantastic landscape and night scenery, the park is also a few minutes away from various signalled trails. Operating since 1993, this is a very quiet and family-friendly park.

title: (5300) - N206
description: On unpaved forest road at a crossroads. Surrounded by low forest in all directions. Okay for one night if you do not want to sleep in the city of Braganza.

title: (5300) Espinhosela - N308
description: Boas shadows with tables for lunch

description: Water tap here, don't know if it's drinking water.

Very quiet and relaxing place.

Today he is clean and at peace. There is not a single toilet paper on the floor. Please, make it clean again. If you urinate or excrete, put the paper and excrement in a bag and throw it in the garbage container

Beach / restaurant / bar / facilities maintained / maintained by a very friendly couple Sergio and his wife (Sergio speaks French!). Cheap meals on request. No water, shower and toilet available (ask Sergio). The place is in a natural park, so guards ensure that the place remains a parking and not more.

title: (49392) Pedralba de la Pradería - camino bajo de repilao
title_short: (49392) Pedralba de la Pradería - camino bajo de repilao
description: 10 km south of the town of Pedralba de la Pradería, towards Santa Cruz de Abranes, in the Sanabria region and framed by the Culebra and Atalaya mountain ranges, is this night area belonging to the Raia Route of North (first European cross-border motorhome route). The area has 8 parking spaces, a gray water disposal area and a black water discharge point, in addition, drinking water can be recharged for an additional fee. It also has a video surveillance camera and a Wi-Fi point. In addition to Pedralba de la Pradería, the towns of Calabor, Lobeznos, Rihonor de Castilla and Santa Cruz de Abranes are part of this municipality. In every city there is something to see, such as, for example, the medicinal waters of the Calabor or Riho mnnor thermal baths in Castile, crossed by the border with Portugal, coexisting with its Portuguese neighbors of Río de Onor. exact address: camino bajo de repilao (carretera de Portugal).

The road from the Zamorano side is sloping, winding and narrow, with a lot of potholes, and some trucks from the AVE works circulate along it. Access from the Galician side does not offer difficulties.

title: (5340) - Azibo

title: (49594) Manzanal de Arriba - Carretera Sagallos
description: Since June 2019, Manzanal de Arriba has a Motorhome area belonging to the Ruta Raia Norte (the first cross-border motorhome route in Europe). The Area is divided into two, counting on the one hand with the eco-sanitary platform (at the entrance of the town of Manzanal if you arrive from Sagallos) and, at 100m, the parking area, next to the ayuntmaiento of the municipality. It has up to 10 parking spaces and a platform for eco-sanitary services for these vehicles, Wi-Fi connection and 24-hour surveillance.

title: (49594) Manzanal de Arriba - 33 Calle las Eras
title_short: (49594) Manzanal de Arriba - 33 Calle las Eras

title: (49362) Galende - 1 Camino Galende
description: Day parking only on the roadside. Perfect to spend the day and take a walk in the surroundings. River beach approx 300 m. Overnight prohibited.

title: (49362) Ribadelago Nuevo - 6 Calle Tajo
description: Sanabria lake next door, fine if you're staying the night here, the site is flat and there are shaded areas

Place of departure of the Sanabria Environmental Cruise. This activity is very good and ideal for children. Parking is usually filled after 12.00.

title: (49360) Galende - 46-48 Calle Ribiella
description: Fantastic place to spend the night. Nearby fountain, a barbecue by the river nearby. Very calm.

title: (49362) Galende - ZA-104
description: Ample parking near a large lake, surrounded by nature, there is a beach and a snack bar, only possible during the day.

name: Camping Los Robles
title: (49361) Camping Los Robles
description: Small but very neat campsite, quiet. 10 minutes walk from one of the beaches of Lake Sanabria. Very welcoming. Good restaurant to eat. Very clean bathrooms. I do not know if they have for emptying black water, gray yes.

title: (5340-310) Macedo de Cavaleiros - 6 Rua das Piscinas
title_short: (5340-310) Macedo de Cavaleiros - 6 Rua das Piscinas
description: In the Center of the village square next to all amenities. Quiet and secure place. Service area in the swimming pool car park with a Euro-relay terminal.

name: Camping Bar Restaurante LOS MOLINOS
title: (49594) Camping Bar Restaurante LOS MOLINOS
description: Camping Bar Restaurante LOS MOLINOS! Camping located on the fluvial beach of Manzanal de Arriba in the Sierra de la Culebra. Very quiet and with a spectacular setting very close to the lakes of Sanabria. It has a bar-restaurant.

title: (49361) Ribadelago - 1 Diseminado Ribadelago Fran
description: Varias plazas en los alrededores del antiguo balneario de bouzas (abandonado) con vistas al lago de sanabria. Acceso por camino con cierta pendiente y bastante roto sólo apto para 4x4. Varias zonas niveladas o fáciles de nivelar. Acceso a un pequeño punto donde bañarse en el lago. Recomendable acceso y estancia con discreción ya que está muy cerca del camping los robles.

title: (5340) Macedo de Cavaleiros - N216
description: Small Atlantic petrol station. Free water service. There is a small sign which indicates that the store must be warned before serving.

title: (5385) Torre de Dona Chama - 98 Rua São Brás
title_short: (5385) Torre de Dona Chama - 98 Rua São Brás
description: Place in front of the chapel Castro Sao Brãs. Grand view at almost 180 degrees. Access only small van (max 6m) or 4x4 motorhome.

title: (49362) Ribadelago - 13 Barrio Alto Ribadelago
description: Parking to visit the Tera River Canyon. We spent the night very quiet, next to the river and the source of drinking water. Kiosk with cold drink very close.

title: (49360) Galende - ZA-104
description: Nice place by the river, for a day .. :) Stony path but easy to access for small camper. Nice decor between mountain and river:) Night prohibited

title: (49362) Ribadelago - 13 Barrio Alto Ribadelago
description: Ribadelago, an esplanade of land, the only place where you can park to visit the town, although the access is by a narrow path.

title: (49360) Galende - 12 ZA-104
description: Free parking, in the middle of the forest by the river away and close to everything. 5 minutes from a large beach through the forest.

title: (32548) La Mezquita - N-525
description: Flat, spacious, clean, recent motorhome area. pitches for caravans with dedicated water points. Motorhome service point. Restaurant in front of the car park with a special menu price

title: (49361) - 148 Diseminado Vigo Sanabria
description: This is a large car park to access the lake which is a weekend destination in the summer. The area is beautiful, crystal clear water with mountain drop-back. There is a bar / restaurant and peddle boats can be rented a bit further along. On the other side of the car park is a popular restaurant. You are not allowed to park here over night as it's within the natural park. If caught you could be facing a hefty fine.

title: (49361) - 151 Diseminado Vigo Sanabria
description: PARKING away under the trees for 5 vans the lake is 3 minutes walk with nautical bass and a snack cafe ???

title: (49594) Manzanal de Arriba - 21 Diseminado Diseminados Codesal
title_short: (49594) Manzanal de Arriba - 21 Diseminado Diseminados Codesal
description: It is a large green area, with a children's play area, a fountain, benches and shadows, on the outskirts of the town. The place is known as La Mota, and from here several routes leave for the surroundings.

title: (5385) - EM206-1
description: Parking of the small chapel. Entry by the small dirt road. Several grassy places but expect wedges or flat concrete platform. Water behind the chapel. In trouble because nothing exceptional but close to the city about 1.5 km with all shops.

title: (5430) - N103
description: Place really very quiet in the middle of the village. Nice view.

title: (49361) Galende - 150 Calle Ballinas Vigo S
description: Recreational area with plenty of parking space. Absolute tranquility. It has tables to eat and a playground. Relatively close to the lake. Apparently you can stay overnight without problem.

title: (49361) Vigo - 133 Calle Ballinas Vigo S
description: Central parking in rural surroundings, very trankilo, and with water intake.

title: (5230) - ANGUEIRA
description: PRAIA FLUVIAL E PARQUE DE MERENDA DE ANGUEIRA The course is located in a quiet area, blending harmoniously with nature, the sun, the sun, the sea and the depth, into the landscape.

title: (49580) Pias - 7 Carretera Porto
description: Quiet place for day and overnight. Nice views of the valley of the Boney rivers. And Barjacova without services very quiet site, good hiking areas

title: (5385) - 14 Largo Aguieira
description: An exceptional natural place near a chapel. A breathtaking view! And absolute calm. The little old man who maintains the chapel was very friendly and even offered to supply us with water. The last hectometres are on a stony path but passable by most vehicles. Big favorite!

title: (49500) Alcañices - 11 Plaza Viviendas Atalaya
description: The Alcañices overnight area is located on the outskirts of town, in a quiet area, but with nearby shops, and a 3-minute drive or 10-minute walk from the recreational area that has a picnic area and children's games. The area belongs to the Raia Norte Route (the first cross-border route for motorhomes in Europe) and has 8 parking spaces, an area for emptying gray water and a terminal for changing black water, in addition, you can recharge drinking water. It also has a video surveillance camera and Wi-Fi point.

title: (49322) Rosinos de la Requejada - ZA-V-2640
description: Secluded and quiet area with picnic tables, barbecue, fountain and prepared bathing area in the river with enough shade. You must park at the entrance to the area (the rest is the area where you can put towels for bathing and leisure). There are swings at 500m. There are no shops, supermarket or bar. The closest to 5km.

title: (49500) Alcañices -
description: Recreational Area of Sahu. Area with picnic areas and children's games. Good place to stop to eat. It has a building that looks like a bar but it was closed.

title: (5430-047) Vilartao - Rua Bandeira
description: Exceptional welcome, extraordinary human qualities. Upon our arrival Xavier and Fatima immediately set a family tone and will pamper you throughout your stay. Do not hesitate to enjoy the exceptional brioche bread and tasty local cuisine finely cooked by Fatima.

title: (49358) San Justo - 1 Diseminado Rabano Sanabria
description: Hermitage of the Alcobilla. An isolated area in the middle of nature. The area is very clean and cared for, the hermitage is surrounded by ancient trees, some picnic tables and a fountain (which had no water). There are also containers. We had a great and quiet night despite being Saturday. On Sunday morning a couple of people walked past us, but without any problem. We loved this place!

title: (49563) Villardeciervos - 102 Calle Real Cional
description: Nice place to spend a day, at the foot of the river beach, we spent the night without problems. It is very flat and with enough space. Chiringuito open in summer (it has a bathroom), the service is excellent.

title: (5230) Caçarelhos - N218
description: A beautiful and typical village to meet and spend the night. Has a small market and two bars. Free drinking water.

title: (49361) Galende - 26 ZA-122
description: Night impossible in summer. In winter, it is possible to do so, although it is a National Park and in the regulations this is prohibited.

title: (5430) Barreiros - R. Principal
description: Spacious parking area with a few trees for shade. 2 kilometers away climb (via ferrata) and swimming possibility. Due to the large truck, I do not go on the sandy path to the river, possibly for a small camper place on the river. Toilet block and bar closed on my visit

title: (49519) Rabanales - 18 Carretera Alcañices
description: "Los Cuatro Castros" Rabanales de Aliste eco-sanitary zone and point. The municipality is located in the region of Aliste, west of the province of Zamora and near the border with Portugal. formed by the territory corresponding to the terms of Fradellos, Grisuela, Matellanes, Mellanes, Rabanales and Ufones. In total, it has an area of 80.29 km² and, according to data from the 2016 INE municipal register, it has a population of 562 inhabitants. The town of Rabanales has an urban area with notable examples of traditional Aliste stone architecture. This area will be inaugurated on September 18, 19 and 20, 2020. The Castellana y Leonesa motorhome association has requested the creation of this area.

title: (32540) A Gudiña -
description: Secluded area near a river, where there are several parking areas. The area is very quiet, with stone tables for snacks. We have come in autumn but there is a natural pool that I imagine will be operational in summer. It is recommended for vans or campers since to get there there is a small narrow bridge that you have to cross. At night there is no light, nor any type of service. Recommended to spend an afternoon or a night.

title: (32540) A Gudiña -
description: Parking near the highway, very quiet and perfect for one night. We just parked on the lawn next to the path, behind the solar panels and had a beautiful view of the sunset.

title: (49583) Porto - 4 Calle Pinguela
description:
Nice and quiet place on the banks of the River with natural pool without services at the entrance of the town, free, good place for hiking.
It belongs to the Raia Norte Route (the first European cross-border motorhome route) and has 8 parking spaces, a grey water emptying area and a black water exchange terminal.

title: (49583) Porto - 10 Calle Margareu
description: Large plot of grass surrounded by nature, children's playground, soccer field, very clean public toilets, a spout with delicious water and a beautiful natural pool. At 11 or so the baker passes by with a van. Beautiful town and great reception of its inhabitants, super friendly and hospitable people. If you are close, do not miss this stop, fall in love !!!!

title: (5430) Lebução - 13 Estrada Nacional
description: Small car park just off the N103. Several picnic tables, water, garbage. Only suitable for a short stopover.

title: (49562) Villardeciervos -
description: A nice place. Outside of high season and during the week there is tranquility. Next to the Valparaíso reservoir. Easy to get to.

title: (49562) Villardeciervos - Unnamed Road
description: Playa de los Molinos River beach in a very beautiful natural setting. There is a beach bar on site. Very quiet and familiar area. Overnight is not allowed.

title: (49562) Villardeciervos - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet area, beach in front of where we were cleared, no truck or dog on the beach, but the guy told us to go in front. Much better.

title: (32540) A Gudiña - 20 Rúa Viana
description: A Gudiña train station. Extensive parking area. WC station. calm, lighted place

title: (32540) A Gudiña - 1 Rúa Beato Sebastián de Aparicio
title_short: (32540) A Gudiña - 1 Rúa Beato Sebastián de Aparicio
description: Site with tables to stop to eat, and a very wide sword to park

title: (32540) A Gudiña - Camino Campo de Fútbol
title_short: (32540) A Gudiña - Camino Campo de Fútbol
description: Parking with cars.

title: (49562) Villardeciervos - 29A Travesía del Riego
description: Municipality belonging to the region of La Carballeda, it is located at the foot of the Sierra de la Culebra that delimits its term to the south and configures a landscape characterized by lush reforestation forests -usually coniferous- and, to a lesser extent, autochthonous forests of oaks, pyrenees and chestnuts. To the north it is surrounded by the estuaries of Agavanzal, Valparaíso and Cernadilla. The urban area that makes up the city was declared a site of cultural interest with the category of historical complex in 1987. The Church of Nuestra Señora de la Asunción and a good number of large houses with two and three floors stand out. built in reddish stonework, masonry or well-locked masonry, in which the external cantilever of its galleries stands out. Area belonging to the Ruta de la Raia du Nord (the first cross-border motorhome route in Europe) and promoted by the Castellana y Leonesa motorhome association. ACYLA

title: (32540) A Gudiña - N-525
description: Nice quiet picnic spot where we spent one night in August with no problems. Not far from the freeway and still very quiet and nice to stand by.

name: Staroil Puerta de Galicia
title: (32546) Staroil Puerta de Galicia
description: Showers at the service station, heating, toilets and water connection.

title: (49310) Mombuey -
description: Since June 2019, Mombuey has had a Motorhome Area belonging to the Northern Raia Route (the first cross-border motorhome route in Europe). The Area has 8 parking spaces and a terminal for paying water changes, in addition, drinking water can be recharged. It also has a video surveillance camera and a Wifi point

title: (32546) A Gudiña - N-525
description: It is a gas station, there is a restaurant open 24/24 and many truckers sleep there, a very big place, with an area to wash the air conditioning. For a day of passage. Hot showers available, just need to ask in the restaurant for a key :)

title: (49564) Villardeciervos - Unnamed Road
description: Corner in nature, bathing impossible because rush, at the edge of the lake, without noise, reserved for vans only. Magical, without noise, far from the world

title: () Porto - Unnamed Road
description: It is a spectacular viewpoint where you and the cows are, peace and quiet, with unbeatable 360 ° views with several routes nearby. Gazebo well clapboards.

title: (2MHC+QR) Mombuey - Unnamed road
description: Parking area with shadows, with a fenced area with free access, with a fountain, swings, picnic tables (picnic areas) in the shade, barbecues and a sand area for games (petanque, bowling,...) Close to the road and the Mombuey exit, where there are many services (gas station, AC Area, supermarkets, bars-restaurants, bakeries, ATMs, Lottery administration,...).

title: (49318) Mombuey - ZA-L-2669
description: Picnic area with accessible water front. Small bar closed out of season. barbecue areas.

title: (49310) Mombuey - Diseminado Diseminados
description: You can sleep here and there is gas and a bar, open 24 hours. There are truckers and more campers here

title: (5230) - Unnamed Road
description: Rest area on the edge of a small lake. It has tables and a playground. Perfect for a night out in the van

title: (5200) - N216
description: Parking with view of the olive trees is the old road

title: () Remondes - N216
description: Very quiet night. Very isolated place along the Rio Sabor. Road that was submerged after the construction of the new bridge. Just after the bridge coming from Pinhero but the same exists on the other side. Very quiet place, nice view. Very little passage on the bridge. Some fishermen in the morning. Place to keep clean. Win waste and toilet paper please. Suitable for small vans (narrow road to turn around)

title: (5200) Mogadouro - N216
description: Close to the N216 bridge, below on a road that has been flooded. Quiet area for swimming. We did not sleep there but no ban.

title: (5225) - 11 Rua da Fraga Mourisca
description: Very nice area with emptying, filling and wastewater. Trees, swimming pool next door. Terrain almost flat gravel. A small dirt road to arrive on about 200m. Very quiet facing the olive groves.

title: (32369) A Veiga - Unnamed Road
description: Nice place next to a river at 100m from the road. Accessible for a camper.

title: (32554) Viana do Bolo - OU-533
description: Nice place at the river, close to the main road but quiet at night. No service but few stone tablet and trash bin. 200 m to a restaurant (often closed)

title: (32365) Ponte - 13 Lugar Puente
description: At the entrance of the town in front of the church there is a small square where several caravans can spend the night and in the same town there are also several places for camper vans. And also in the same town there are fountains and a river passes where we can wash. There are 4 hiking trails for nature lovers.

title: (32366) Edreira -
description: Sendero "o rañadoiro" Parking for 1 or 2 next to the untraveled road where it begins a beautiful path to a stellar viewpoint Surrounded by mountains, splendid views Quiet place, only the wind is heard, which hits strongly Recommended

title: (5200-200) Mogadouro -
description: Small wasteland at the exit of Magadouro ideal for a night in trouble arrived at 21h on 11/01/18. No problem with the police who saw us settle down with some plastic detritus but acceptable, downtown nearby.

name: Parque Campismo de Mogadouro
title: (5200-202) Parque Campismo de Mogadouro
description: Well-kept municipal campsite, clean sanitary facilities, washing machine. In addition to the municipal sports park with swimming pool, guests can collect free cards at the reception. Very friendly and helpful managers. Baker arrives at camp around 9 am with freshly baked rolls.
